contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had an adverse reaction to a vaccine component.

contraindication.observationTitle: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of cholera
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of cholera vaccine.

seriesAdminGuidance: The Vaxchora package insert states that CVD 103-HgR should not be given to patients who have received oral or parenteral antibiotics in the preceding 14 days, because antibiotics might have activity against the vaccine strain.
Non-U.S. vaccines (WC-rBS and BivWC) would count as valid only if there is documentation that a complete series with the appropriate dosing has been given.
No data exist on use of the currently available lyophilized CVD 103-HgR formulation in immunocompromised populations.

observationCode.text: Travel to an area of active cholera transmission

indication.description: Administer to adult travelers (aged 18-64 years) from the United States traveling to an area of active cholera transmission.
